# Scale: Harmonic in B (Mode: Lydian #2)

## Introduction
The Harmonic scale in B, also known as the Lydian #2 mode, is a fascinating and exotic scale that can add an interesting flavor to your music. By blending the characteristics of the Lydian mode with an augmented second interval, this scale produces a unique and otherworldly sound that can be both haunting and uplifting.

## Notes and Intervals
The Harmonic scale in B consists of the following notes:
- B, C#, D#, E#, F#, G, A#

The intervals in this scale are as follows:
- Root (B)
- Major 2nd (C#)
- Augmented 2nd (D#)
- Augmented 4th (#4 or E#)
- Perfect 5th (F#)
- Major 6th (G)
- Major 7th (A#)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Harmonic scale in B, also known as the Lydian #2 mode, is often associated with genres like jazz fusion, progressive rock, and world music. Its unique interval structure gives it a dreamy and exotic quality that can transport listeners to far-off lands or evoke a sense of mystery and wonder. Musicians often use this scale to add color and complexity to their compositions, creating rich harmonies and unexpected melodic twists.
